description.en: Macroeconometrics course covers topics in basic to intermediate level  time series analysis. The primary goal of the course is to give students an overview of the modern time series analysis and methods, illustrated with practical applications ranging from empirical macroeconomics to empirical finance. The students are supposed to have a prior knowledge of basic statistics, probability theory and mathematical analysis. During the course these skills will be developed into econometric methods suited for analysis, modeling and inference of time series data in a variety of fields in economics. Each topic will be complemented by empirical applications and exercises using the real-world datasets.
description.et: Makroökonomeetria kursus hõlmab valik teemasid alg- kuni kesktaseme  aegridade analüüsist. Kursuse põhieesmärk on anda üliõpilastele ülevaade kaasaegse aegridade analüüsist ja meetoditest, mida on illustreeritud praktilistel rakendustel alates empiirilisest makroökonoomikast kuni empiirilise rahanduseni välja.  Õpilastel peaksid olema eelteadmisi põhistatistikast, tõenäosusteooriast  ja matemaatilisest analüüsist.  Need oskused arendatakse edasi ökonomeetrilisteks meetoditeks mis on sobivad aegridade analüüsimiseks, modelleerimiseks ja hindamiseks erinevates majandusteaduse valdkondades. Iga teema juures on kasutatud näiteid ja harjutusi mis põhinevad empiirilistel rakendustel reaalsetel andmetel.

objectives.en: Introduce the students to the most common state-of-the-art time series models.
objectives.et: Tutvustada üliõpilastele põhilisi makroökonomeetrilisi ja aegridade ökonomeetria meetodeid.

learning_outcomes.en: After taking the course students will know:
·	how to use methods of time series econometrics for the analysis of macro data
learning_outcomes.et: ·	kasutada erinevaid aegridade ökonomeetria meetodeid makroandmete analüüsiks

learning_outcomes.en: ·	test various properties of economic time series (stationarity etc)
learning_outcomes.et: ·	testida majandusandmete aegridade erinevaid omadusi (statsionaarsus jne)

learning_outcomes.en: ·	how to use software packages for the estimation of time series models
learning_outcomes.et: ·	kasutada tarkvarapakette makro- ja aegridade ökonomeetria mudelite hindamiseks.

description.et: 50% of the final grade is comprised of the final written exam, the primary aim of which is to access the students command of the theoretical concepts studied during the semester. The grading scale for the final written exam is relative to the average level achieved across all students.

50% of the final grade is comprised of the empirical project, written by the students in small groups of 2-5 participants. Students are supposed work on their empirical projects throughout the semester. The grading scale for the empirical projects is relative to the average level achieved across all groups.

50% of the final grade is comprised of the final written exam, the primary aim of which is to access the students command of the theoretical concepts studied during the semester. The grading scale for the final written exam is relative to the average level achieved across all students.

grade_evaluation.et: 50% of the final grade is comprised of the final written exam and 50% of the empirical project paper --- both have to be carried out to qualify for the final course grade

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

description.et: Estimation of univarite ARMA models with likelihood-based methods I
Estimation of univarite ARMA models with likelihood-based methods II
Estimation of univarite ARMA models with likelihood-based methods III
Models for non-stationary time series and the unit root hypothesis I
Models for non-stationary time series and the unit root hypothesis II
Models for non-stationary time series and the unit root hypothesis III
Multivariate structural VAR models and their estimation I
Multivariate structural VAR models and their estimation II
Multivariate structural VAR models and their estimation III
